item.title: Michelle add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by James Paul Gee
item.description: "Learning is a deep human need, like mating and eating, and like all such needs it is meant to be deeply pleasurable to human beings." -- James Paul Gee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by W.B. Yeats
Michelle add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Michelle add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Oh I don't mind going to weddings, just as long as it's not my own..." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "My desire and wish is that the things I start with should be so obvious that you wonder why I spend my time stating them. This is what I aim at because the point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There are times in life when people must know when not to let go. Balloons are designed to teach small children this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "A path is only a path, and there is no affront, to oneself or to others, in dropping it if that is what your heart tells you . . . Look at every path closely and deliberately. Try it as many times as you think necessary. Then ask yourself alone, one question . . . Does this path have a heart? If it does, the path is good; if it doesn't it is of no use." -- Carlos Castaneda

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "For me there is only the traveling on paths that have heart, on any path that may have heart, and the only worthwhile challenge is to traverse its full length--and there I travel looking, looking breathlessly." -- Carlos Castaneda

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same." -- Carlos Castaneda

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same." -- Carlos Castaneda
